sentences.en: At his touch, the common thing became sublime with heavenly music.
sentences.cn: 在他的演奏下, 普通的事物在神圣的音乐声中变得崇高起来.

sentences.en: At times the show veered from the sublime to the ridiculous.
sentences.cn: 有时表演会突然从高雅而变得低俗。

sentences.en: He displayed a sublime indifference to the distinction between right and wrong.
sentences.cn: 他对是非之间的差别根本就无动于衷。

sentences.en: Her songs are a sublime fusion of pop and Brazilian music.
sentences.cn: 她的歌曲是流行乐和巴西音乐的巧妙融合。

sentences.en: It is also beyond doubt the most sublime.
sentences.cn: 也毫无疑问是最崇高的时期.

sentences.en: Many added that he looked sublime and prophetic.
sentences.cn: 不少的人还说他显得崇高,像个先知.

sentences.en: Many species have been wiped out through sublime ignorance.
sentences.cn: 许多物种由于人们的极端无知而灭绝了.

sentences.en: Sublime is the dominion of the mind over the body.
sentences.cn: 精神对肉体的制约是至高无尚的.

sentences.en: Sublime music floats on a scented summer breeze to the spot where you lie on the lush grass.
sentences.cn: 你躺在绿草如茵的草地上，涤荡心灵的乐声随着清香的夏日微风飘到你的身边。

sentences.en: Sublime music floats on a scented summer breeze to the spot where you lie.
sentences.cn: 优美的音乐随着充满香气的夏日微风飘到了你躺着的地方。

sentences.en: That, his position and attitude were, on the whole , sublime.
sentences.cn: 此人的立场和态度确属崇高伟大.

sentences.en: The book contains sublime descriptive passages.
sentences.cn: 这本书中有好几个优美的描写片段.

sentences.en: The church was beautiful and sublime.
The imagination of man is naturally sublime.
sentences.cn: 人类的想像当然是非凡的.

sentences.en: Thomas Carlyle , notwithstanding his tedious rhetoric, is a master of the sublime in prose style.
sentences.cn: 尽管 托马斯·卡莱尔 的语言花俏冗长,但是他仍不失为一位令人崇敬的散文文体大师.

words.tran_cn: 纯净化的；理想化的；高尚的
[物] 升华，[心理] 升华作用；高尚化；升华物

trans.tran_cn: 庄严的，雄伟的，令人赞叹的，极端的，傲慢的
trans.tran_en: used to describe feelings or behaviour that are very great or extreme, especially when someone seems not to notice what is happening around them

trans.tran_cn: 庄严，崇高，至高无上，顶点
trans.tran_en: something that is so good or beautiful that you are deeply affected by it
